title: Maziar Zare
text:
Maziar Zare Eshghdoost (, born 22 December 1984 in <a href="Bandar%20Anzali">Bandar Anzali</a>, <a href="Iran">Iran</a>) is a retired <a href="Iran">Iran</a>ian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player and current coach. He was a right-footed <a href="midfielder">Defensive Midfielder</a>.
He is dubbed as "The New Ghayeghran" after the late <a href="Sirous%20Ghayeghran">Sirous Ghayeghran</a>, <a href="Malavan%20F.C.">Malavan</a>'s legend and also wore the coveted number 9 shirt.
Club career.
He Played 4 seasons for <a href="Malavan%20F.C.">Malavan</a> and moved to <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a> in the summer of 2008 and played in <a href="AFC%20Champions%20League">AFC Champions League</a> for the team and was the regular player for the team which he took the penalties. After a disappointing season in UAE he returned to <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a> in 2010 and won the <a href="Hazfi%20Cup">Hazfi Cup</a> in the first season. He was one of the regular players of the team during the second season but was mostly substituted towards the end of the season when <a href="Mustafa%20Denizli">Mustafa Denizli</a> was the coach. In June 2012, he moved back to <a href="Malavan">Malavan</a> along with former teammate <a href="Pejman%20Nouri">Pejman Nouri</a>. 
International career.
Maziar Zare was a member of <a href="Iran%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Iran national under-23 football team</a> in the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202006%20Asian%20Games">2006 Asian Games</a>, where he scored a 30-yard strike for Iran. He was called up to the senior squad in June 2007 for the <a href="West%20Asian%20Football%20Federation%20Championship%202007">West Asian Football Federation Championship 2007</a>. He made his debut for <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran</a> in a match vs <a href="Iraq%20national%20football%20team">Iraq</a>. He played in the <a href="2010%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">2010 FIFA World Cup qualification</a> and <a href="2011%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup%20qualification">2011 AFC Asian Cup qualification</a> for <a href="Team%20Melli">Team Melli</a>.
He also was invited in June 2011 by <a href="Carlos%20Queiroz">Carlos Queiroz</a> to participate in the <a href="2014%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">2014 FIFA World Cup qualification</a>.
